summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to MoneyGram International, Inc., dated September 3, 2019, demanding financial records related to money transfers and money orders. It is part of a criminal investigation into suspected violations of federal laws including sex trafficking and conspiracy, and includes a request for non-disclosure to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued and signed the grand jury subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date for MoneyGram
events.description: The date by which MoneyGram International, Inc. is commanded to appear before the grand jury or produce the requested financial records.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office issues a grand jury subpoena to MoneyGram International, Inc. for financial records as part of a criminal investigation.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The subpoena targets MoneyGram International, Inc. for records on money transfers and money orders, indicating a financial investigation into potential money flows related to the case.
The investigation involves alleged violations of federal criminal laws including 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c), 2422(b) (coercion and enticement), and 371 (conspiracy).
The U.S. Attorney's Office explicitly requests non-disclosure of the subpoena's existence to any third party to preserve the investigation's confidentiality and prevent interference.
The document is dated September 3, 2019, showing active investigative steps were being taken by federal authorities after Jeffrey Epstein's death in August 2019.
